title: Ticket #5244: Improve security UX
description:
The default security settings should be improved to make it easier for our administrators to use higher-security methods. In particular, if we changed the (param table) default for the HTCondor map file to a particular value, we could create a file for the corresponding location (and use the packaging to install it) which does what the hard-coded defaults do (if there's no map file at all). After adding support for comments in the map file, we could then explain the options there. This seems like a best practice.

Additionally, if we preserve the GSS_ASSIST_GRIDMAP (?) default for GSI in the HTCondor map file, we could (more?) easily add a metaknob 'use security : gsi' for administrators which already have GSI configured.

A detail for Zach to consider is what to do if an entry in the map file is missing. Presently, security rejects, but this allows abuse of the mapfile as a whitelist, and changing those semantics would be Bad(TM). Perhaps we could map to unmapped@method instead, and add 'unmapped@*' to the default DENY list(s), instead?

[This may have been prompted by Brian Lin.]
